title: Eliminate the X Variable
text: We can multiply equation 3 by -3 and add to the second equation to get $$3y=10z=-13$$. This eliminates the x-variablee in one equation, but we must do it in another as well. So, we can multiply equation 3 by -2 and add to the third equation to get $$5y-8z=-13$$

title: Solving for x, y, and z
text: With the equations derived in the previous steps, we can solve for z. We can multiply $$5y-8z=-13$$ by $$\frac{-5}{3}$$ and add to $$3y-10z=-13$$ to get $$z=1$$. This can be substituted back into $$5y-8z=-13$$ to get $$y=-1$$. All this can be substituted into the first equation to get $$x=1$$.
